A simple visualization of Covid19 cases with R, using package tidyverse for the most part.
<!--more-->

A simple visualization of Covid19 cases with R, using package tidyverse for the most part.

Tidyverse is a set of R packages for data science. It includes packages to use in everyday data analyses, such as readr, dplyr, tidyr, ggplot, tibble, stringr, purr and many others with more specialised usage.

Loading tidyverse:

```{r}
library("tidyverse")
```

Downloading data from JHU repo and loading into R:

```{r}
time_series_raw_confirmed <- read.csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/CSSEGISandData/COVID-19/master/csse_covid_19_data/csse_covid_19_time_series/time_series_covid19_confirmed_global.csv")

time_raw_covid19_deaths <- read.csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/CSSEGISandData/COVID-19/master/csse_covid_19_data/csse_covid_19_time_series/time_series_covid19_deaths_global.csv")

time_series_raw_recovered_global <-  read.csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/CSSEGISandData/COVID-19/master/csse_covid_19_data/csse_covid_19_time_series/time_series_covid19_recovered_global.csv")
```

Checking out the dimensions:

```{r}
dim(time_series_raw_confirmed)
```
